newsitem.title: BRAZIL: RESEARCH ALERT-Cesp still a Flemings.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Cesp still a Flemings.

text.p: -- Robert Fleming & Co Ltd said in a report it has reiterated its buy recommendation on shares of Brazilian state power utility Companhia Energectica de Sao Paulo (Cesp)
-- "We reiterate our buy particularly since the stock is 15.5 percent off its high of 63 reais in February," wrote Fleming analyst Walter Stoeppelwerth.

-- He said Cesp's "strong growth in generation and distribution volumes, coupled with a 64.9 percent load factor, confirmed our bullishness on the underlying quality of the company's generation assets."

-- Excluding its 1.97 billion-real stake in CPFL, 1.3 billion-real distribution franchise and 211 million-real stake in Comgas, Cesp's 10,232 megawatts (MW) of capacity are being valued at $910,000 per MW, he added.
-- "We are convinced that Cesp's hydroelectric plants are worth at least $1.5 million per MW," Stoeppelwerth said.
-- The plants offer Latin America's best load factor and are close to clients, he said, adding there is an increasing scarcity of low-cost generation in Brazil.
-- Cesp common closed Wednesday at 54.60 reais while its preferred ended at 54.00 reais in Sao Paulo.
